oResponds to requests from investigative sites in a timely fashion 
oMentors junior level CRAs and serves as a resource for new employees

Clinical Research Assistant II Palo Alto Veteran's Institute for Research August 2013  – Present (2 years 1 month) Palo Alto 1) Cancer stem cell research:

•Assist in the preparation of amendments to protocols and/or modifications to study design as appropriate. 
•Review, Abstract and synthesize study data. 
•Complete the required annual training of Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and Human Participant Protection Education (HPPE) for VA human studies research.

Experience Study Coordinator Stanford University September 2014  – Present (1 year) Etkin Lab, Stanford Psychiatry & Behavioral Sciences Currently working on neuroimaging studies aimed at elaborating affective processing in Depression, Anxiety, PTSD, and related conditions. Studies utilize and assess novel methods of TMS in psychiatry research, integrating TMS simultaneously with functional MRI and EEG. Primary study focuses specifically on a basic sciences approach to human research, using direct brain simulation to examine the casual mechanisms associated with related neural networks, and how these pathways differ in individuals with and without psychiatric symptoms. Assists in study design, subject recruitment, image acquisition and processing, and data analysis. Locations include VA Palo Alto Health Care System, Stanford University Psychiatry Department, Richard M. Lucas Center for Imaging, and the Center for Cognitive and Neurobiological Imaging at Stanford University. Involved in additional studies utilizing structural MRI, rTMS, eyetracking, psychophysiology, and EEG methods. Undergraduate Research Assistant Mood and Anxiety Disorders Laboratory January 2013  –  June 2014  (1 year 6 months) Stanford University Primary researcher in a study of the psychophysiological underpinnings of Generalized Anxiety Disorder. Tasks included study design, subject recruitment, data collection, data processing, and data analysis. Collection and primary analysis culminated in thesis presentation at the end of the spring. Received grant funding for 2013 summer to begin work on senior thesis project. Undergraduate Research Assistant Life-Span Development Laboratory November 2011  –  December 2013  (2 years 2 months) Stanford University Performed various lab tasks, such as subject recruitment, data collection, data entry and analysis, study design, and literature reviews. Studies focused on the affective aspects of aging, with an emphasis on socioemotional selectivity theory. Received grant funding for 2012 summer to work 40 hours per week on a study assessing musical preferences across the lifespan.  Sr. Assessment Manager, GCP Compliance BioMarin Pharmaceutical Inc. March 2015  –  May 2015  (3 months) Assessment Manager, GCP Compliance BioMarin March 2013  –  May 2015  (2 years 3 months) The purpose of this position is to manage and lead GCP Audits to assure that all aspects of clinical studies conducted by BioMarin have been executed in compliance with applicable US FDA, ICH GCP Guidelines and other government and/or country specific regulations. 
In addition: 
• Actively participate in managing and sustaining a level of inspection readiness for BioMarin’s early stage to late stage development products, to include core membership of the Regulatory Inspection Team. 
• Lead the identification of internal GCP quality issues, be a catalyst for process improvements, and partner with Clinical Operations and Clinical Development functional groups to promote standardization and best practices. 
• Manage respective regulatory commitments and company responses to closure and provide effectiveness verification. 
• Lead the development of clinical compliance systems and processes as assigned. Experience Health Science Specialist Veterans Health Administration August 2009  – Present (6 years 1 month) VAPAHCS Among other things, I have been:

Previous projects: 
--Participated in taxonomy updates, deployment, and regional testing of a computer application designed to provide clinical decision support in response to patient pain and prescription of opioid-based medications

--Recruited and tracked participants for one of three VA sites investigating the effects of mental health interventions on the health outcomes and treatment rates of (primarily Vietnam-era) Veterans with Hepatitis and concurrent psychosocial concerns a two-year span of participation in the program.
